title: CHE 7110 Mathematical Methods in Chemical Engineering (3)
description: Review of physicochemical problem formulation; analytical and approximate techniques for the solution of linear and nonlinear differential equation models in chemical engineering systems.

title: GEOG 4047 Geographic Information Systems (3)
description: Geographic information systems used in land resource management and planning; data structures and algorithms for automated retrieval and analysis of spatial data; structuring cartographic data into spatial data; integration of remotely sensed data into geographic information systems.

title: GEOG 4042 Enterprise Geographic Information Systems (3)
description: The use of vector-based GIS application software for the input, management, analysis and presentation of geospatial data. Emphasis is placed on how the GIS relates to database management systems as part of building an enterprise-wide GIS.

title: GEOG 4043 Crime GIS (3)
description: Also offered as . Advanced spatial crime analysis, modeling, and mapping using Geographic Information Systems (GIS).

title: ISDS 7530 Information Systems Analysis and Design (3)
description: Analysis and design of information systems from a management perspective; software development methodology; topics include requirements determination; feasibility determination; project management; evaluation of a software development strategy and application design; modeling using ER diagrams and DFDs; systems implementation.

title: ISDS 7230 Project Management (3)
description: Topics of effectively managing projects including setting goals and objectives, project planning, evaluation and review; incentives and qualitative analysis and project accounting; extensive use of cases involving hands-on computer analyses with state-of-the-art project management software.

title: ISDS 7302 Predictive Analytics (3)
description: Predictive analytics in business; business cases in predictive analytics; data mining use in business; industry solutions for predictive analytics.

title: ISDS 7150 Emerging Markets Energy Supply Chain Management (3)
description: Emerging markets; global energy supply chain; entrepreneurial opportunities in energy; opportunities in retail global supply chain, product life cycle and global supply chain, energy supplier clusters and emerging markets, and information technology and global supply chain; life-saving supply chain and disaster management; greening the global supply chain; industry studies; and opportunities for the growing Louisiana economy.

title: ISDS 4123 Computer and Networking Security (3)
description: Security management, corporate risk assessment, access control, authentication, transmission control protocol and Internet protocol packet content analysis, firewall hardware and software, types of encryption, cryptographic systems, application security issues and laws governing security and privacy.

title: ISDS 4113 Management of Information Systems Projects (3)
description: Topics on effectively managing information technology projects including: setting goals and objectives; work breakdown structures; project scheduling; managing project resources; evaluation and review; incentives and qualitative analysis; project accounting; extensive use of cases involving hands-on computer analyses with state-of-the-art project management software.

title: ISDS 2001 Business Statistics and Analytics II (3)
description: Advanced statistical methods;Â ANOVA and multiple linear regression; predictive analytics; decision analysis.

title: LHRD 4068 Project Management and Team Leadership in LHRD (3)
description: Introduction to the conceptualization and development of project plans, project management strategies and the leadership and development of project teams in human resource and leadership development.

title: LA 7401 Graduate Landscape Ecology (3)
description: Basic principles of ecology and environmental systems; application of ecological principles and relationships to resource, recreation and landscape planning, with attention to conservation ethics and legal regulations leading to sustainability of the landscape.

title: LA 7075 GIS for Designers (3)
description: Introduction to Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and Science (GISc) for designers.

title: LA 7044 Ecology and Technology IV (3)
description: Construction practices in landscape architecture, focusing on the primary components of built environments: materials, assemblies, and technique; the principles of sustainability as it relates to construction and materials; advanced materials and emerging technologies.

title: LA 5301 The Practice of Landscape Architecture (3)
description: Professional practice for landscape architects including issues associated with licensure, practice types, professional services, business developments, contracts and project management.

title: LA 4001 Landscape Design V: Landscape Planning and Development (6)
description: Landscape planning and design from the regional to the site development scale; emphasis on generating planning and design strategies for urbanization and development that are informed by an understanding of the ecology and culture of the region and based on principles of sustainability.

title: LA 3301 Landscape Technology II: Grading & Stormwater Management (3)
description: Grading and drainage with emphasis on designing landscapes that consider aesthetics, accessibility, safety, ecology, and sustainability. Introduction to water quality and management, erosion control, and roadway design. Emphasis on advanced grading and landform manipulation skills, and stormwater system design and calculations.

title: ME 4213 Welding Engineering I (3)
description: Fundamentals of welding and joining; introduction to nondestructive evaluation; basics of welding technology and welded structures; GMAW and GTAW; shielded metal arc welding processes.

title: PBS 7525 Advanced Veterinary Clinical Pathology (1-2)
description: Diagnosis and pathogenesis of hematological and clinical chemistry changes in blood from various animal species; understanding the applicable instrumentation and methodologies of assays and quality assurance; interpretation of cytological specimens (tissue and fluids) and correlation with clinical and histopathological findings.

title: PHIL 2021 Environmental Thought (3)
description: The relationship between humans and the natural environment: ethical and scientific considerations. Topics may include: the environment through human history, the development of environmental science, ethical obligations to non-human animals, environmental protection and pollution.

title: PETE 7232 Thermal Methods of Oil Recovery (3)
description: Theory of heat transfer and heat generation applied to the performance prediction of oil recovery by such field processes as forward and reverse in situ combustion, continuous and cyclic hot fluid injection, and production well heating.

title: PETE 4089 Natural Gas Engineering (3)
description: Application of reservoir engineering principles and practices to gas and gas-condensate reservoirs; prediction of gas well performance; management of all types of gas reservoirs; underground gas storage.

title: PETE 4085 Surface Handling of Produced Fluids (3)
description: Operating principles and design criteria for equipment used in field processing of oil and gas, e.g., lean oil gasoline plants, gas dehydration units, gas sweetening units, cryogenic gasoline plants, separators, gas transmission and compression facilities.

title: PETE 4084 Fluid Flow and Heat Transfer in Wellbores (3)
description: Multiphase flow in pipes and wells; flow pattern description and mechanistic modeling; wellbore heat transfer; case studies.

title: PETE 3320 Fundamentals of Carbon Capture, Utilization and Storage (3)
description: Fundamentals of carbon capture, utilization and storage. CO value chain. Capture and separation, transportation, utilization and storage.

title: PHYS 2203 Introductory Modern Physics (3)
description: Elementary modern physics; special relativity, wave/particle duality, quantum mechanics, hydrogen atom, many-electron atoms, nuclear structure elementary particles, solid state, astrophysics and cosmology.

title: PBS 7419 Population Dynamics and Ecology of Parasitic and Vector-Borne Diseases (3)
description: Population regulation and distribution of parasitic and vector-borne diseases of veterinary and medical significance; disease risk in populations and control strategies based on population models, transmission dynamics, climate, nutrition, immunity, geographic information systems and herd health programs.

title: PADM 7913 Advanced Topics in Human Resource Management in the Public and Non-Profit Sector (3)
description: Advanced topics in human resource management including human resource management and organizational structure, workforce diversity, technology, legal and ethical issues, public policy issues, improving productivity and other special topics of interest. Topics will vary from semester to semester.

title: PADM 7912 Public Human Resource Management (3)
description: Explores human resource policy, including procedures and principles of personnel administration; traditional aspects of personnel administration including recruiting, job classification, evaluation, and compensation and dynamic topics include workforce diversity, drug abuse, whistle blowing, sexual discrimination, labor relations and other relevant issues.

title: OCS 4600 Global Environmental Change: Past, Present and Future (3)
description: Patterns and processes of global climate changes during the Quaternary and their links to the biosphere, cryosphere and ocean; proxies and archives; climate forcing and biotic responses; current warming and future impacts; human ecology of climate change; energy supply and human health; sustainability and policy.

title: OCS 4242 Wetlands and Water Quality (3)
description: An integrative view of wetland ecosystems with an emphasis on eutrophication and water quality.

title: NFS 7010 Food Toxicology (3)
description: Principles of risk assessment, food chemical safety and toxicology; mycotoxins, aquatic toxins; natural toxins; food additives; and other food toxins.

title: NFS 4040 Quality Assurance in the Food Industry (4)
description: See .

title: NFS 3119 Fundamentals of Quantity Food Production (4)
description: Principles and practical application of quantity food procurement, production, distribution and service; menu development; sanitation and safety; materials and resource management and development.

title: MATH 7311 Real Analysis I (3)
description: Abstract measure and integration theory with application to Lebesgue measure on the real line and Euclidean space.

title: ME 4202 Mechanical Engineering Capstone Design II (2)
description: Principles from heat transfer, thermodynamics, design, fluids and materials courses utilized to complete the project set forth in the preliminary design outline submitted in .

title: ME 4183 Theory and Design of Mechanical Control Systems (3)
description: Basic principles, concepts, characteristics and performance of linear feedback control systems; stability of linear systems; frequency response methods; compensator design in the frequency domain.

title: ME 3752 Material Selection for Mechanical Engineers (2)
description: Analysis of mechanical and other properties of engineering materials required for material selection; advanced engineering materials in mechanical engineering; applications and problems in processing and shaping; materials in selected mechanical systems.

title: ME 3633 Manufacturing Processes & Methods (3)
description: Modern manufacturing processes integrated into total manufacturing systems; CAD/CAM flexible manufacturing operations; metal casting, forming, removal; welding processes and machinery; fine measurement, inspection and quality assurance.

title: ME 3333 Thermodynamics (3)
description: Basic laws of thermodynamics, availability, perfect gases and pure substances, fluid flow and basic heat transfer.

title: ME 2334 Thermodynamics (4)
description: Thermodynamic systems and control volumes; thermodynamic properties of simple substances, work and heat; 1st and 2nd law; power and refrigeration cycles; ideal gas mixtures, water-vapor mixtures and psychrometric chart; combustion.

title: MKT 4490 Services Marketing (3)
description: Developing, pricing, distributing and promoting the service; control of quality of customer encounters through service automation and/or employee selection and training; place of marketing in service organization structure; strategic implications of structure of service industries.

title: MGT 4523 Legal Issues in Human Resource Management (3)
description: An examination of the most significant laws and court rulings influencing companiesâ employment practices; topics include: anti-discrimination statutes, affirmative action, commonly committed workplace torts, occupational safety and health laws, workersâ compensation and wrongful termination.

title: MGT 4430 Managing Across Cultures (3)
description: Introduction to the basic principles of cross-cultural management. Students will examine both the theory and practice of international management concepts across three modules: (1) foundations of global business, (2) the role of culture, and (3) international organizational behavior and human resource management.

title: MGT 3320 Strategic Human Resource Management (3)
description: The planning and implementation of HR policy at the strategic level of an organization, including recruitment, selection, development, maintenance and reward of employees; relationships with environment and employee associations.

title: MGT 3280 Management Internship (3)
description: Students, supervised by a management faculty member and an approved business executive, will follow a predetermined schedule of activities while working for a business firm. Hands-on experience in the fields of management, human resource management, organizational behavior, small business management, entrepreneurship, and administrative practices.

title: MGT 3200 Principles of Management (3)
description: Management functions, including planning, organizing, staffing/human resource management, leading/interpersonal influence and controlling in both domestic and international spheres.

title: MEDP 7331 Radiation Therapy Physics (3)
description: Fundamental physical principles, operation of delivery equipment, treatment planning principles, methods of dose calculations, determination of irradiation time from dose prescription, dose measurements and quality assurance for external beam therapy (photons and electrons) and internal brachytherapy.

title: MEDP 7280 Advanced Clinical Radiation Therapy Physics Rotation (2)
description: Under the supervision of clinical medical physics staff, introduction to the planning, delivery and dosimetric aspects of advanced radiation therapy treatments such as brachytherapy, stereotactic radiosurgery, total skin electron therapy, intensity modulated radiotherapy and image guided radiotherapy and to the advanced physical practices of accelerator quality assurance and radiation therapy shielding design.

title: MEDP 7270 Advanced Radiation Therapy Physics (3)
description: Basic principles of clinical indications, radiation delivery, treatment planning, dose calculations, dose measurements and quality assurance for advanced treatment techniques used in radiation therapy (external beam electron, proton and photon therapy and internal brachytherapy).

title: MEDP 7260 Clinical Medical Physics Rotation (4)
description: Under the direction of clinical staff, introduction to clinical duties of the medical physicist in radiation therapy and radiology. Radiation therapy physics topics include treatment planning, delivery techniques and dosimetry for brachytherapy and external beam therapy. Radiological imaging physics topics include operation and quality assurance for CT, MRI, and PET imaging systems and radiation safety.

title: ME 7673 Advanced Mechanical Systems Control (3)
description: Design and analysis of nonlinear control systems; adaptive and robust control techniques; state estimation; stability theory; control and stability of distributed parameter systems.

title: ME 7443 Advanced Heat Transfer II (3)
description: Convection heat transfer.

title: ME 7433 Advanced Heat Transfer I (3)
description: Steady and transient heat conduction; fundamentals of radiation heat transfer.

title: ME 7343 Computation of Fluid Flow and Heat Transfer (3)
description: Finite-difference methods for solving equations of fluid motions and energy; computer program use to solve complex problems involving fluid flow; heat transfer and chemical reaction; mathematical models for turbulence; radiation and combustion; their computing implications; application of prediction procedures for practical situations.

title: ME 4963 Nuclear Reactor Systems Engineering (3)
description: Engineering aspects of reactor systems; nuclear fuel cycles, isotope separation, mechanical and thermal design, selection of materials and environmental impact of nuclear facilities.

title: ME 4853 Turbomachinery (3)
description: Preliminary design of axial- and radial-flow pumps, compressors and turbines; determination of optimum flow angles and dimensions, blade design, blade selection and performance prediction.

title: ME 4763 Fundamentals of Corrosion Science and Engineering (3)
description: Corrosion principles; polarization, passivation, inhibition and other phenomena; principal methods used in corrosion prevention.

title: ME 4733 Deformation and Fracture of Engineering Materials (3)
description: Effect of temperature, strain rate, corrosion, and microstructure on stress-strain behavior and fracture of engineering materials, including metals, ceramics and plastics.

title: ME 4723 Advanced Materials Analysis (3)
description: Concepts and operation of modern analytical instruments using photon or electron beams and X-rays; macroscopic and microscopic examination of materials coupled with separate and combined testing of mechanical, tribological and corrosion properties.

title: ME 4633 Internal Combustion Engines (3)
description: Classification of internal combustion engines, gas turbines, cycles with different components, spark-ignition gasoline engines, detonation, carburetion, compression-ignition engines, combustion and diesel knock, fuel atomization and atomizers, combustion chambers, two- and four-stroke cycle engines and supercharging.

title: ME 4621 Thermal Science Laboratory (1)
description: Laboratory demonstrations and experimentation in fluid mechanics, thermodynamics and heat transfer concepts.

title: ME 4443 Introduction to Combustion (3)
description: Basic principles of combustion and their application in solving engineering problems.

title: ME 4433 Heat Transfer (3)
description: Principles of heat transfer by conduction, radiation and convection.

title: ME 4223 Welding Engineering II (3)
description: Fundamentals and intermediate level welding and joining; intermediate nondestructive evaluation emphasizing phased-array-ultrasonics; design calculations of welded structures; advanced welding processes.

title: IE 7724 Independent Study in Industrial Engineering (1-3)
description: Independent study in specialized areas such as design and analysis of complex production systems, supply-chain control, maintenance, quality control, reliability, ergonomics and human-computer interaction, information systems, safety and construction management.

title: IE 7722 Special Topics in Industrial Engineering (3)
description: Special topic courses in specialized areas such as design and analysis of complex production systems, supply-chain control, maintenance, quality control, reliability, ergonomics and human-computer interaction, information systems, safety and construction management.

title: IE 7429 Analytics and Data Science in Industrial Engineering (3)
description: Analytics and machine learning techniques and applications within Industrial Engineering. Topics include overview of the analytics process, data management & preparation, descriptive analytics (including business intelligence and data visualization techniques), clustering, classification, predictive analytics (regression & time series), text mining, and prescriptive methods.

title: IE 7428 Semantic Analysis (3)
description: Automated determination of semantic content (a.k.a. meaning) of text and speech and applications to human-computer and human-machine interfaces and task automation.

title: IE 7425 Advanced Information Systems Engineering (3)
description: Advanced concepts of information systems engineering with emphasis on middleware architectures/technologies for integrating databases; design issues and methodology for developing and implementing distributed information systems; and design and implementation of data-warehouses and online analytical precessing (OLAP) systems.

title: IE 4520 Supply Chain Logistics II (3)
description: Supply chain logistics; operational elements, general operations and functionality; sourcing, market characterization, materials management; storage systems, warehousing operations and management; logistics coordination; customer relationships, transport mechanism, multi-modal transportation; distribution, freight and shipping logistics; supply chain technologies; global issues and government policies/regulations.

title: IE 4453 Quality Control & Six Sigma (3)
description: Principles and practice of quality assurance and control; theory of statistical sampling and control and related economic analysis; Quality Systems; Six Sigma principles and practice.

title: IE 4425 Information Systems Engineering (3)
description: Analysis and design of information systems; projects relating comprehensive computer systems to typical industrial and service applications; ethics and professionalism.

title: IE 4426 Distributed Information Systems Engineering (3)
description: Analysis, design, and development of database-driven web and mobile applications and web services in industrial, business, and ecommerce settings.

title: IE 4113 Project Management (3)
description: Project management and theory practice. Practical approach to organizing, planning, and controlling projects in information systems, healthcare, manufacturing and services.

title: IE 3520 Supply Chain Logistics I (3)
description: Introduction to supply chain and logistics systems; manufacturing and supply logistics resource optimization; procurement, ordering, coordination and materials management; supply logistics networks and material flow problems; transportation problems, shortest delivery routing, maximum flow problems, and resource scheduling.

title: IE 2400 Methods and Systems Engineering (3)
description: System and work design concepts; time studies; performance rating and allowances; standard and pre-determined times; work methods improvement; design of manual work, equipment and tools and work environments; line balancing; manpower determinations, job analysis and incentives; business systems analysis, lean and value analysis.

title: ID 4773 Principles of Sustainability (3)
description: The principles, theory, and application of sustainability to advance environmentally responsible interior environments; introduction to natural systems, interior environmental quality, systems, ethics, and stewardship.

title: ID 4761 Professional Practice (3)
description: Entering the profession; interior design business practices; ethics and project management.

title: ID 1780 Interior Design Technical Drawing (3)
description: Introduction to the graphic tools, techniques and conventions designers use to communicate architectural ideas; an immersion in the graphic language of drawing.

title: GBUS 3302 Predictive Analytics (3)
description: Business cases in predictive analytics; data mining use in business; industry solutions for predictive analytics.

title: EXST 4142 Introduction to R and Statistical Data Mining (3)
description: Introduction to R and advanced statistics for data mining, machine learning, and predictive analytics; topics include shrinkage methods in linear models; generalized linear models; cross-validation; decision trees; bagging and random forest; principal components analysis; cluster analysis and association rules mining.

title: ENVS 7623 Toxicology I (3)
description: Fundamental principles of toxicology, dose response relationship, design and conduct of acute and chronic toxicity tests, basic analytical toxicology, biochemical markers, basic principles of hazard evaluation and risk assessment, industrial toxicology, principles of toxicology applied to the environment and ecosystems.

title: ENVS 7112 Concepts in Marine Ecotoxicology (3)
description: Marine pollution and toxicology of industrial and non-point sources materials related to ecological risk assessment in costal and marine areas; biological processes and wastes in the ocean; physicochemical processes and wastes in the ocean; laboratory and field techniques in epibiotic, endobiotic and fecal-sestonic habitats; benthic habitats and metals/chemical specification/geoavailability; fish as a biological model; microcosm theory and design for littoral and neritic habitats; approaches to ecological risk assessment in marine habitats.

title: ENVS 7110 Toxicology of Aquatic Environments (3)
description: Aquatic pollution and toxicology of industrial materials related to environmental risk assessment in coastal areas; physical, chemical and biological factors affecting the fate of toxicants in marine and freshwater coastal areas.

title: ENVS 7061 Watershed Biogeochemistry (3)
description: Biogeochemical processes in watersheds; sources and effects of water pollutants; water quality standards and criteria; total maximum daily loads; watershed approach and application of mathematical models to water quality management.

title: ENVS 7077 Environmental Impact of Artificial Intelligence (3)
description: Introduction to AI techniques for solving problemsÂ related to climate change, greenhouseÂ gasÂ emission, sustainability, energyÂ useÂ efficiency, biodiversity, and conservation; real-time analyses using AI in the field.

title: ENVS 7048 Natural Resources Law and Policy (3)
description: Legal frameworks and resultant policy debates surrounding natural resources management; mechanisms by which law and policy facilitate resource management in the U.S. and worldwide; assessment of the science supporting such management.

title: ENVS 7047 Environmental Economics and Policy (3)
description: Economic concepts applied to the development of appropriate policies to achieve environmental protection goals; emphasis given to linkages between economics and the environment, the role of market failure and economic instruments that can be used to address environmental concerns.

title: ENVS 4900 Watershed Hydrology (3)
description: The principles of hydrology with emphasis on how natural systems are analyzed, modeled and used in management decisions; laboratory exercises involve hands-on experience with hydrologic data analysis, use of geographic information systems (GIS) and spatial modeling.

title: ENVS 4261 Energy and the Environment (3)
description: Methods of stationary power generation; pollution related to fuel production, transportation and use; energy use and pollution problems related to transportation; energy resources, regulatory aspects and control technology related to stationary and moving sources of air pollution.

title: ENVS 4149 Design of Environmental Management Systems (3)
description: Use of geographic information systems as the backbone for environmental management systems; identifying major issues, drivers, guidelines, and principles in the design of such systems.

title: ENVS 4113 Multi-Media Chemical Behavior for Risk Assessment (3)
description: Characterization of the behavior and fate of anthropogenic chemicals in coastal and marine ecosystems; develop an understanding of model conceptualizing for the biological, chemical and physical processes and mathematical formulation of these processes; assess risk of human and environmental biota to exposure to these hazardous substances.

title: ENVS 4010 Applied Ecology (3)
description: The biosphere, air, land and aquatic environments; development of alternative techniques for correcting environmental pollution; environmental risk assessment analysis and management.

title: ENVS 1126 Introduction to Environmental Sciences (3)
description: Essential principles of environmental sciences; comprehensive and fundamental understanding of sound science, stewardship and sustainability in environmental sciences; interactions and relations between humans and earth; an up-to-date look at todayâs global, national and regional environmental issues.

title: GEOL 4043 Earth Materials, Energy Systems, and the Environment (3)
description: Earth materials as solutions to the energy transition and climate crisis; mineral and fluid properties; carbon sequestration; rare earth elements; solar, wind, geothermal and nuclear energy.

title: GEOG 7973 Advanced Geographic Information Systems (3)
description: Theory and methods of design, development, implementation and applications of geographic information systems.

title: GEOG 7945 Socioeconomic Applications of GIS (3)
description: Applications of Geographic Information Systems in business, social, economic, and public policy studies.

title: GEOG 4086 Human-Environment Interactions (3)
description: Cultural adaptation to difficult and distinctive environments, including mountains and highlands, the arctic, deserts, the humid tropics and grasslands; subsistence strategies, local knowledge, household economies, land use practices and resource management institutions.

title: GEOL 7081 Isotope Geochemistry (3)
description: Stable isotope fractionation in natural systems; emphasis on oxygen, hydrogen, and carbon isotope-ratio variation in natural waters, carbonates and silicates with application to the solution of petrologic problems.

title: HIST 4113 Modern European Intellectual History Since 1850 (3)
description: European thought affecting society in the industrial age; realism, psychoanalysis, existentialism, the information explosion.

title: HORT 4020 Greenhouse Management and Controlled Environment Agriculture (4)
description: Operation and management of greenhouses and other controlled environments with emphasis on system design and construction, control of light intensity and photoperiod heating and cooling systems, substrates, mineral nutrition, water quality and irrigation systems.

title: FIN 7718 Multinational Financial Management (3)
description: Cross border investment, investment analysis, capital planning, foreign currency exposure and cash management; concepts of political risk assessment; techniques in transactional trade; alternative financial sources; issues in international financial controls.

title: EVEG 4154 Sustainability Engineering (3)
description: Engineering analysis and design approaches that minimize impacts on the environment, human health and social conditions; ecodesign; life cycle assessment; full-cost accounting; pollution prevention.

title: EVEG 4136 Water Quality Analysis Laboratory (1)
description: Water quality analysis of wastewater and natural waters.

title: EVEG 3271 Senior Project I: Consulting Format (3)
description: Project management (proposals, flow charts, technical content) mimicking methodologies utilized by professional consulting firms; findings presented using professional format, i.e., final reports address rationale, process treatment trains and/or process sizing.

title: EVEG 3145 Environmental Engineering III (3)
description: Application of chemical principles to water quality problems in the area of water supply, wastewater treatment, and pollution of natural waters. Fundamentals of equilibrium chemistry, chemical kinetics, organic and colloidal chemistry as applied to environmental engineering.

title: EVEG 3110 Water and Wastewater Treatment (3)
description: Physical, chemical and biological characteristics of water and wastewater; water quality regulation; basic reactor engineering; operation and simple design of physical, chemical and biological unit processes in water and wastewater treatment.

title: EE 7585 Advanced Digital Control Systems (3)
description: Theory and design of sampled-data control systems: including discretization of continuous-time systems and lifting of sampled-data systems; performance analysis in frequency and time domain; design techniques based on optimal controls; robustness analysis of sampled-data feedback control systems under plant perturbations.

title: EE 7510 Advanced Linear Systems (3)
description: Modern approaches for the analysis and identification of linear, discrete and continuous time, control systems; state variable and fractional description techniques, functional analytic methods.

title: EE 7484 Grid Integration of Renewable Energy (3)
description: Grid requirements for Photovoltaic and wind energy systems; Generators and converter structures for wind energy systems; Photovoltaic converter structures; Grid converter control for photovoltaic and wind energy systems.

title: EE 7474 Power Systems Operation and Optimization (3)
description: Concepts, models, and solution methodologies for power systems operation; application of optimization techniques for power generation and transmission management.

title: EE 7425 Dynamics of Microgrids (3)
description: , . Transient stability analysis in micro grids, modeling of power systems for control and stability analysis, flexible ac transmission systems, renewable energy integration, and voltage stability.

title: EE 7422 Advanced Electric Machines
description: Topics on special purpose electric motors used in automation, robots and electric or magnetically levitated vehicles.

title: EE 4444 Power System Reliability (3)
description: Fundamental knowledge on the reliability evaluation of engineering systems with emphasis on electric power systems; models and methodologies for power systems reliability assessment; application of probability theory for design and management of power generation, transmission and distribution systems.

title: EE 4434 Renewable Energy Generation Systems (3)
description: Conventional power generation issues; introduction to renewable energies and their integration into power grids; design of photovoltaic and wind microgrid generation stations; energy storage applications and models.

title: EE 4431 Modeling and Analysis of Modern Power Systems (3)
description: Analysis of power systems with penetration of renewable energy systems, microgrid and smart grid design considerations, load flow algorithms, symmetrical and unsymmetrical fault analysis, basic principles of modern power system modeling and analysis in steady state operation including, components modeling and network modeling.

title: EE 4247 Chemical and Biological Sensors (3)
description: Fundamentals of chemical and biological sensors; molecular recognition and transduction principles; fundamentals of electrochemical sensors, optical and mass-sensitive sensing techniques, and performance factors of chemical and biological sensors.

title: ENGR 7050 Future Faculty Development Seminar (2)
description: Open to all engineering and construction management graduate students. Provides fundamental skill sets and knowledge needed to successfully prepare for an academic career in engineering.

title: EMS 4087 Best Practices for Environmental Sustainability in Agriculture (3)
description: No Description Found

title: EMS 4020 Quantitative Risk Assessment (3)
description: Assessment of environmental risks; interactions of pollution/toxins with the human body; managing and predicting risks.

title: EMS 3050 Environmental Regulations and Compliance (3)
description: Local, state and federal environmental regulations; enforcement of and compliance with regulations; roles of regulatory agencies.

title: ENTM 7017 Introduction to Insecticide Toxicology (3)
description: Principles of toxicology as they relate to insecticides; bioassays, risk assessment, mode of action, pharmacokinetics, insecticide resistance and selectivity.

title: DMAE 7115 Digital Media Production & Project Management (4)
description: Production and management principles encompassing the entire project cycle.

title: THTR 7622 Scenery Automation (3)
description: Examination of scenery control systems, including PLC programming, positioning control, software and all in-one control systems.

title: AEEE 2004 Introduction to Metals and Welding in Agricultural and Extension Education (3)
description: Introduction to Shielded Metal Arc Welding (SMAW), Gas Metal Arc Welding (GMAW), and Oxy-fuel welding/cutting. Emphasis on the theoretical foundation of welding, safety, skill development, and management of facilities, materials, and equipment.

title: ANSC 4040 Quality Assurance in the Food Industry (4)
description: Laboratory functions, manufacturing processes and microbiological, chemical and statistical techniques used to provide complete quality assurance for the modern dairy food plant.

title: AGRO 4087 Best Practices for Environmental Sustainability in Agriculture (3)
description: A comprehensive instruction of practices and strategies available to mitigate the environmental effects of many agricultural practices; focus on both structural Best Management Practices (BMPs) and management based BMPs used in both animal and agronomic crop production; new and emerging pollution reduction strategies.

title: AGRI 3900 Study Abroad Experiences in Agriculture (1-3)
description: History, development, and current practices in agricultural production, sustainability, marketing, economics, and natural resource management. Course available only as part of a study abroad program.

title: ANTH 4042 Enterprise Geographic Information Systems (3)
description: See .

title: ANSC 4087 Best Practices for Environmental Sustainability in Agriculture (3)
description: No Description Found

title: ATRN 7402 Principles of Healthcare Administration in Athletic Training (3)
description: An overview of administrative concepts and organization of health care facilities that provide athletic training services. Topics covered include: facility design, fiscal and human resource management, insurance and reimbursement, legal and ethical practices, and healthcare informatics.

title: ARCH 5001 Comprehensive Architectural Design (6)
description: Emphasis on the comprehensive design of a single building integrating material selection, mechanical, acoustical, structural, lighting and two- and three-dimensional studies.

title: ARCH 4041 Issues in Sustainability (3)
description: Examination of issues in sustainability as they relate to the practice of architecture.

title: ARCH 3008 Environmental Control Systems (3)
description: Principles and practices of selection and design of mechanical systems, including lighting, electrical distributions, acoustics, plumbing, vertical transportation and fire suppression.

title: BE 4383 Natural Resource Engineering (3)
description: Engineering analysis and design of natural resource control systems, including open channels, vegetated water-ways, terraces, water control structures, spillways, reservoirs, flood control, surface water quality and wetlands.

title: BE 4352 Transport Phenomena in Biological Engineering (3)
description: Mass balances with consideration of chemical and biological reaction kinetics; energy balance and principles of conduction, convection and radiation including 3-D diffusion, transient heat transfer and convection analysis; energy transfer in engineering design and analysis; principle of mass transfer.

title: BE 4342 Sugar Process Engineering (3)
description: Processes used in the manufacture of raw and refined sugar; application of scientific and engineering principles to unit operations of evaporation, crystallization, extraction, solids handling and drying, centrifuging, clarification and steam and power generation.

title: BE 4340 Food and Bioprocess Engineering (3)
description: See .

title: BE 4310 Biofuels and Bioproducts from Renewable Resources (3)
description: Principles of biofuel and bioproducts production using different technologies. Fundamental concepts are used to design different engineering processes required for production of bioethanol, biodiesel, bio-oil, and other biobased products, including harvesting and logistics.

title: BE 3381 Nonpoint Source Pollution Engineering (3)
description: Water quality criteria and regulations for the agricultural community; production, treatment and disposal of agricultural and food processing wastes; management of agricultural nutrients; nonpoint source pollution; bi-product utilization; land application; wetland restoration; stream sampling and analysis; re-aeration studies and modeling.

title: BADM 7501 Cybersecurity Risk Management (3)
description: Cybersecurity frameworks; cybersecurity governance; cybersecurity and privacy regulations; intrusion techniques; cybersecurity incidentÂ responseÂ reports; National Institute for Science and Technology (NIST) methodology for IT system risk assessments, NIST assessment methodology.

title: ART 3994 Advanced Photography (3)
description: Technical investigation of contemporary materials; critical testing of equipment, films and printing papers; emphasis on process control as an expressive tool.

title: BIOL 4015 Conservation Biology (4)
description: Same as . Principles and concepts of conservation biology; practical applications of conservation biology to design, management and restoration of ecologically sustainable preserves at local, regional, and global scales; threats to biological diversity and sustainability resulting from human population growth, resource exploitation, and global climate change.

title: CE 7180 Water Quality Simulations (3)
description: Water quality modeling from a perspective of practicality and reliability; emphasis on model calibration and verification procedures and methodologies for quantifying uncertainties associated with model predictions.

title: CE 7105 Advanced Topics in Water Quality and Treatment (3)
description: Theory and application of advanced chemical principles to water quality and treatment; advanced equilibrium chemistry calculation; redox and colloidal chemistry as applied to environmental engineering.

title: CE 4750 Professional Issues and Concept Design in Civil Engineering (2)
description: Engineering Graphics. Civil engineering design processes and systems; constructability and sustainability; use of consultants and contractors; project management, scheduling; economics and costing; ethical, health and safety; social, political and environmental considerations.

title: CFS 8000 Thesis Research (1-12)
description: Directed research and focused project development under the supervision of the major professor.

title: CHEM 4571 Organometallic Chemistry (3)
description: Chemistry and principles of metal bonds with metal to carbon sigma and pi bonds; bonding concepts, electronic structure, periodic trends and fundamental reaction mechanisms; applications to homogeneous catalysis.

title: CHEM 4564 Chemical Synthesis Laboratory (3)
description: Laboratory course in organic, inorganic, and polymer chemistry with an emphasis of modern synthetic methods and characterization techniques.

title: CHEM 4559 Electroanalytical Chemistry (3)
description: Basic principles of electrochemical reactions, electroanalytical voltammetric methods for analysis, the chemistry of heterogeneous electron transfers, electrochemical instrumentation, micro- and nano- electrodes, surface modification for electro-catalysis and sensing.

title: CM 7303 Environmental Life Cycle Assessment (3)
description: Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) as a science-based technique to guide policy and decision-making that enhances sustainability. Computational structure and data sources for SETAC LCA; Input-output LCA and Hybrid LCA as tools to select a superior alternative on the basis of pollution prevention and resource conservation.

title: CM 7220 Building Information Modeling for Construction Management (3)
description: Concepts related to the implementation of BIM in construction projects from the perspective of the general contractor; topics include applications of BIM for visualization, marketing, quantity take-off, scheduling, coordination, and facilities management.

title: CM 7207 Independent Study in Construction Management (3)
description: Independent study in specialized areas of construction management. Research on a construction topic as chosen by the student under direct supervision of a chosen graduate faculty member.

title: CM 7206 Special Topics in Construction Management (3)
description: Graduate level advanced topics, current issues or recent developments in the construction industry.

title: CM 7150 Decision Making Tools in Construction Management (3)
description: Reviewing decision-making techniques that can be used by construction managers to assist in making decisions under uncertainty; decision-making techniques include financial and decision theory techniques along with sensitivity analysis; examples drawn from the construction industry as well as engineering.

title: CM 7111 Advanced Construction Scheduling (3)
description: Advanced techniques in schedule development and implementation for effective project management during the planning and construction phases of a project, including monitoring, updating, and controlling the project schedule and computer software applications.

title: CM 7010 Research Methods in Construction Management (3)
description: Identification and formation of construction management research problems, design of a research process, research information resources, numerous research methods, data collection and analysis methods, and presentation and dissemination of research results and findings.

title: CM 4311 Disaster Resilient Construction (3)
description: Hazard identification, project siting, building code requirements, and above-code practices for natural hazard/disaster resilient construction.

title: CM 4303 Life Cycle Assessment (3)
description: Computational structure and data sources for SETAC LCA, input-output LCA and hybrid LCA as tools selects a superior alternative on the basis of pollution prevention and resource conservation.

title: CM 4221 Construction Project Management (3)
description: Field management of a project from inception to completion, including personnel needed, business aspects, estimating and bidding aspects, communication, record keeping, monitoring and control of project, risk and claims management, safety, and close out.

title: CM 4206 Special Topics in Construction Management (3)
description: Advanced topics, current issues or recent developments in the construction industry.

title: CM 4202 Construction Enterprise (3)
description: A comprehensive study of construction management as it relates to a single construction enterprise.

title: CM 3237 Residential Project Management (3)
description: Focus on managing residential projects from construction planning to completion and warranty work. This will include residential industry participants, organization of the project team, outside influences on scope and performance in the residential construction industry, blending proven practices with the experiences of builders in the field.

title: CM 3112 BIM for Construction Management (3)
description: Principles of BIM and its application to project execution tasks, planning and sequencing, spatial coordination and clash detection, as well as BIM support for field operations and facility management.

title: CM 2215 Construction Safety (3)
description: Construction safety relating to accident causation; contractual obligations; project management and coordination.

title: CM 2101 Construction Materials and Methods I (3)
description: Principal materials and methods used in building construction, emphasizing common construction systems such as light wood frames, masonry bearing walls, steel frames, and reinforced concrete as well as project planning, work methods, materials, equipment, and sustainability.

title: CM 2100 Construction Materials and Methods I (3)
description: Principal materials and methods used in building construction, emphasizing common construction systems such as light wood frames, masonry bearing walls, steel frames, and reinforced concrete as well as project planning, work methods, materials, equipment, and sustainability.

title: CM 1112 Construction Materials and Methods I (3)
description: Principal materials and methods used in building construction, emphasizing common construction systems such as light wood frames, masonry bearing walls, steel frames and reinforced concrete as well as project planning, work methods, materials, equipment, and sustainability. Drawing identification and quantity take off will be introduced.

title: CM 1070 Introduction to Sustainability in the Built Environment (3)
description: Basic principles of sustainability in the built environment; interactions between the built environment and humans/nature; fundamentals of sustainable practices within the built environment to protect the natural environment and human health; overview of green materials, products, and rating systems in the built environment.

title: CM 1011 Introduction to Construction Management (3)
description: A survey of the construction industry to include an orientation to essential elements of professional practice and development in construction management.

title: CSC 4370 Software Modeling Techniques (3)
description: Examination of modern modeling techniques for complex/high quality software including static/dynamic software models and project management models.

title: CSC 4332 Software Quality & Testing (3)
description: Concepts of software testing and quality assurance, including test generation, test oracles, black box and white box testing, integration testing, test coverage, regression testing, mutation testing, program analysis, test driven development, test automation, and test prioritization.

title: CHE 7700 Advanced Topics in Chemical Engineering (3)
description: One or more phases of advanced chemical engineering practice.

title: CHE 7592 Design Problems in Chemical Engineering (3)
description: Prior to registration students should discuss a prospective design problem with faculty member under whom they plan to study and obtain departmental approval. Design problem cannot be directly related to studentâs research. Integration of technology into design of systems or plants for accomplishing specific objectives; emphasis on producing a design package considering technical, economic, manning and scheduling aspects of the project.

title: CHE 7542 Catalysis (3)
description: Heterogeneous catalysis; adsorption phenomena, physical methods, solid state spectroscopies and reaction mechanisms as applicable to fundamental and industrially significant processes.

title: CHE 7530 Computational Methods in Chemical Engineering (3)
description: Advanced computational modeling techniques widely used in one or more of the following areas that are relevant to the modern chemical engineering discipline, including: catalysis and reaction engineering; thermodynamics; transport phenomena; process control.

title: CHE 7520 Advanced Topics in Biochemical Engineering (3)
description: Overview of current research topics in biochemical engineering, including metabolic engineering to produce commodity products, genetic engineering for enhanced therapeutics, enzyme kinetics, cell growth dynamics, data mining and managing large data sets generated by âomics fields, and mathematical modeling of biological systems.

title: CHE 7140 Chemical Reactor Design Methods (3)
description: Basic principles of chemical kinetics, fluid flow, heat transfer and mass transfer used in design of chemical reactors; chemical equilibria, chemical kinetics, design of isothermal reactors, effects of nonideal flow, nonisothermal reactors and solid-gas catalytic reactions.

title: CHE 7120 Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics (3)
description: Thermodynamic properties, first and second laws of thermodynamics, entropy, Maxwell relations, and relationship of thermodynamic properties to intermolecular forces; physical equilibrium with emphasis on partial free energy, fugacity, Raoultâs law, K-values, equations of state, and activity coefficients; chemical equilibrium and free energies; fundamentals of statistical mechanics.

title: CE 4320 Coastal Engineering (3)
description: Engineering problems of the coastal zone; coastal processes, wave action, currents, sediment movement; environmental forces due to waves, currents and winds; offshore soil geotechnical properties, vertical and lateral pile capacity; design principles for submarine pipelines and offshore platforms; engineering case studies.

title: CE 2250 Fluid Mechanics Laboratory (1)
description: Measurement and calibration of hydraulic machinery; pump and turbine efficiency; flow in pipelines; viscosity; discharge coefficients.

title: CHE 7100 Chemical Engineering Fluid Mechanics (3)
description: Foundations of continuum fluid mechanics and the equations of motion; solution methods for lubrication flows, creeping flows, boundary layer problems, laminar flows with strong convection; introduction to selected topics including: turbulence, non-Newtonian fluids, interfacial flows, computational fluid dynamics, microfluidics, particle motion, droplet dynamics.

title: CHE 4488 Process Separations Design and Synthesis (3)
description: Synthesis and design of separation processes in the chemical manufacturing industry.

title: CHE 4480 Technical Leadership in Chemical Engineering (3)
description: Focuses on technical leadership fundamentals for chemical engineers, including: ethics and professionalism; time management; building trust and credibility; risk taking; leadership through questions; creating a vision; team building and teamwork; running an effective meeting; conflict management and resolution; communication; and presenting difficult messages.

title: CHE 4420 Special Topics in Chemical Engineering Science (3)
description: One or more phases of current chemical engineering science.

title: CHE 4410 Special Topics in Chemical Engineering Design (3)
description: One or more phases of current chemical engineering design.

title: CHE 4275 Electrochemical Engineering (3)
description: Introductory course in transport science. Principles of electrochemistry applied to engineering problems; potential distribution theory, kinetics, mass transport and thermodynamic principles; quantification of controlling factors in microfabrication, corrosion, battery design and electrochemical synthesis.

title: CHE 4272 Chemical Processing of Nanomaterials (3)
description: Chemical engineering principles applied to preparation, handling and applications of nanomaterials. Emphasis will be on manufacturing and processing steps. Case studies will be developed to focus on specific device or material applications.

title: CHE 4260 Biochemical Engineering (3)
description: Application of chemical engineering fundamentals to microbiological and biochemical systems; problems peculiar to industrial operations involving microbial processes; growth conditions and requirements, metabolisms, product separations, enzyme catalysis, sterilization and aseptic operations.

title: CHE 4253 Introduction to Industrial Pollution Control (3)
description: Quantitative application of chemical engineering principles to removal of objectionable components from effluents, with emphasis on industrial processing effluents; currently available techniques for controlling air and water pollution and solid wastes; concept of pollution control through basic process alterations developed by specific examples.

title: CHE 4230 Advanced Process Control Systems (3)
description: Advanced process control tools; modern industrial control technology; process optimization and control; integrated systems control.

title: CHE 4222 Chemical Engineering Project II (2)
description: A continuation of , comprehensive development project of a practicalÂ nature, involving a team effort over two semesters (fall and spring periods).

title: CHE 4221 Chemical Engineering Project I (1)
description: Comprehensive development project of a practical nature, involving a team effort over two semesters (fall and spring periods).

title: CHE 4210 Industrial Catalysis (3)
description: Principles of the industrial utilization of heterogenous catalysis; topics include absorption phenomena, methodology in catalyst preparation, characterization and evaluation of catalysts, diffusion and reaction in porous catalysts and a survey of major industrial processes.

title: CHE 4162 Unit Operations Laboratory (3)
description: Obtaining and interpreting data needed to solve typical problems in design or operation of chemical engineering equipment.

title: CHE 4151 Unit Operations Design (4)
description: Unit operations analyzed as applications of chemical engineering fundamentals and transport sciences; use of these principles in design calculations.

title: CHE 3901 Independent Research II (3)
description: A continuation of , individual study of a specific chemical engineering problem or individual laboratory research.

title: CHE 3410 Sustainability in Chemical Engineering (3)
description: Methods of engineering and life cycle analysis in a contemporary sustainability context. Topics include resources assessment, energy extraction/capture, conversion, distribution, storage, and consumption; environmental and economic consequences; local to global scales; and exergy and exergy analysis with examples from CO2 capture.

title: CHE 3900 Independent Research I (3)
description: Individual study of a specific chemical engineering problem or individual laboratory research.

title: CHE 3249 Co-op in the Chemical Engineering Industry (3)
description: Students will engage in coursework related to their experiences garnered during their co-op assignment.

title: CHE 3171 Introduction to Design and Process Safety (3)
description: a grade of âCâ or better in Introduction to process design, equipment selection, capital and operating economics, optimization and process safety.

title: CHE 1100 Introduction to Chemical Engineering (1)
description: Overview of what chemical engineers do, including guiding principles of the discipline and basics of large-scale chemical engineering problem solving.

title: CHE 2171 Chemical Engineering Fundamentals: Material and Energy Balances (4)
description: Emphasis on basic principles and concepts used to make chemical engineering calculations; techniques used in these calculations applied to typical industrial problems. A three hour computer lab will reinforce lecture material and give practical experience with computer simulation packages.

title: CHE 2172 Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics (3)
description: Basic concepts and chemical engineering applications of thermodynamics; emphasis on flow processes and real gas thermodynamics.

title: CE 7455 Finite Element Method in Engineering (3)
description: Finite element method as an extended Ritz technique based on variational concepts for continua with applications to heat transfer, flow through porous media, fluid dynamics, elasticity, plasticity and stability and vibrations of elastic systems.

title: TAM 7038 Merchandise Trends and Practices in Apparel and Textile Industry (3)
description: Identify the current trends and issues in fashion merchandising such as e-tailing, multichannel retailing, retail technology, environmental sustainability, globalization, and experiential retailing. Introduce the theories, concepts, and processes related to management level problems.

title: POLI 4022 American Constitutional Law of the Criminally Accused (3)
description: Political Relevance of major federal constitutional limitations with particular focus on the Fourth, Fifth, Sixth, and Eight amendments and the criminal justice system.

title: RNR 7007 Policy Considerations for the Management of Natural Resources (3)
description: Review of the history of U.S. natural resource policy to include the policy process and policy conflicts. Development of skills needed to evaluate natural resources policy. Focus on agricultural policy and public policy concerning land, endangered species, environmental regulations and incentive programs.

title: RNR 4150 Forest Hydrology and Soils (3)
description: Principles of hydrology and soils with emphasis on forest environments. Forest soil development, role of forests in the hydrologic cycle, and the role of soil and water in natural resource management.

title: RNR 4106 Techniques in Limnology and Fisheries (2)
description: Quantitative techniques in habitat, water quality and fish population assessment in freshwater ecosystems.

title: RNR 4101 Capstone: Natural Resources Management, Policy and Human Dimensions (4)
description: Development of problem-solving skills for the management of renewable natural resources; application and integration of renewable natural resource management theory, policy, practices and human dimensions; analysis of management and policy decisions.

title: RNR 4061 Special Problems in Natural Resource Management (1-4)
description: Individual, independent, mentored, and directed study.

title: RNR 3036 Field Studies in Mensuration (2)
description: Exercises in designing and conducting timber and multipurpose cruises; boundary location and other types of land surveying associated with forest resource management.

title: RNR 3004 Photogrammetry, GPS and GIS (3)
description: Principles, interpretation and use of aerial photos, Global Positioning Systems (GPS) and Geographic Information Systems (GIS) in stand measurements and forest management applications.

title: RNR 2102 Natural Resource Measurements and GIS (3)
description: Introduction to sampling techniques in measuring renewable natural resources, such as trees, wood products, forest stands, wildlife and fisheries populations and water quality. Introduction to use of global information systems (GIS) and global positioning systems (GPS) applications in natural resource management.

title: RNR 2072 HONORS: Principles of Wildlife Management (4)
description: Population management, habitat management and policy associated with wildlife management. Sustainability of hunting and of endangered wildlife species. Indirect effects of toxins, eutrophication, human infrastructure and climate change on wildlife habitat and wildlife populations.

title: RNR 2061 Problems in Natural Resource Management (1-4)
description: Individual, independent, mentored, and directed study.

title: RNR 1002 Issues in Natural Resource Management (1)
description: Discussions of the ecological, economic, sociocultural and political factors that affect human relationships with the natural environment and the exploitation and conservation of water, forest, range, wildlife, wetland and fisheries resources.

title: SOCL 4466 Crime Mapping (3)
description: Fundamentals of crime mapping and crime analysis with spatial data using geographic information systems (GIS).

title: RNR 7152 Potamology (3)
description: Physical, chemical, and biological processes of rivers; relationships among drainage area, runoff, discharge, floodplain, and flood risk; river-coast continuum; human impacts on river, water quality, and ecosystems; river restoration and management.

title: TAM 3050 Sustainability for Apparel and Textiles (3)
description: Brief review of contemporary environmental, social, and economic issues associated with industry practice will be followed by a broad exploration of sustainable design theories, which may be applied in the apparel and textiles fields, from eco-efficiency to approaches that demand social change.

title: TAM 1100 Fashion and Society (3)
description: Definitions and exploration related to the study of fashion. important theories used to study dress practices will be highlighted, including dress as non-verbal communication and cultural concepts affecting beauty ideals, body modification, gender, ethnicity, the life cycle and sustainability.

title: TAM 7900 Research and Project Development in Textiles, Apparel and Merchandising (1-12)
description: Directed research and focused project development under the supervision of the major professor.

title: ACCT 4236 Environmental, Social, and Governance (3)
description: The study of Environmental, Social, and Governance based on the United Nationâs 10 Principles and 17 Goals of Sustainability of ESG and SEC disclosure requirements.

title: ACCT 3222 Auditing (3)
description: Theoretical and practical development of the independent audit function; generally accepted auditing standards; collection and evaluation of audit evidence; understanding internal control; risk assessment; transaction cycles; and reporting.
